item.title: 英国法院决定在伦敦而非莫斯科审理价值 100 亿美元的喷气机纠纷案
item.description: 伦敦高等法院周四裁定，再保险公司和飞机租赁公司为 200 多架滞留在俄罗斯的喷气式飞机寻求赔偿的 100 亿美元大战应在伦敦而非莫斯科审理。【原文：A $10 billion battle between reinsurers and aircraft leasing companies seeking payouts for more than 200 jets stuck in Russia should be heard in London rather than Moscow, London's High Court ruled on Thursday.】

item.title: 瑞银将商业地产下滑列为首要风险
item.description: 瑞士联合银行周四指出，商业房地产市场的低迷是该行面临的 "首要和新出现的风险 "之一，因为借贷成本上升和大流行病后办公空间需求的下滑对该行业造成了冲击。【原文：UBS flagged on Thursday the downturn in commercial real estate markets as one of the "top and emerging risks" facing the Swiss bank, as higher borrowing costs and a post-pandemic slump in demand for office space hit the sector.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯在柴油机失效装置集体诉讼案中部分败诉
item.description: 德国一家法院周四裁定，在针对梅赛德斯-奔驰柴油机排放失效装置的集体诉讼中，消费者部分胜诉。【原文：A German court ruled on Thursday partly in favour of consumers in a class action suit against Mercedes Benz over diesel emissions defeat devices.】

item.title: 报告称 2024 年全球智能手机市场将反弹
item.description: Counterpoint Research 公司周四发布的一份报告称，随着通胀缓解推动新兴市场需求复苏，以及人工智能的集成吸引买家购买高端设备，今年全球智能手机出货量预计将反弹 3%。【原文：Global smartphone shipments are expected to rebound 3% this year as easing inflation aids a demand recovery in emerging markets and the integration of generative AI attracts buyers to premium devices, a report by Counterpoint Research said on Thursday.】

item.title: 沃尔格林下调全年利润预期，减值 58 亿美元
item.description: 沃尔格林博姿联盟（Walgreen Boots Alliance）周四以零售业务面临经济挑战为由，下调了 2024 财年利润预期的上限，并对 VillageMD 业务计提了 58 亿美元的减值。【原文：Walgreen Boots Alliance cut the higher end of its profit forecast for fiscal-year 2024 on Thursday, citing economic challenges for its retail operations, and took a $5.8-billion impairment related to its VillageMD business.】

item.title: 民意调查 随着需求增长和供应限制的持续，预计油价将更加坚挺
item.description: 路透社周四的一项民意调查显示，随着需求回升以及欧佩克+产油国集团的减产措施继续挤压已经受到军事冲突压力的供应，今年油价将获得一些上涨动力。【原文：Oil prices will gain some momentum this year as demand picks up and output curbs by the OPEC+ producer group continue to squeeze supply that is already being pressured by military conflicts, a Reuters poll showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 荷兰政府将推出将 ASML 留在荷兰的计划
item.description: 荷兰政府预计将于本周四制定初步计划，以阻止该国最大的公司 ASML 将业务迁出荷兰，原因包括反移民政策和基础设施问题。【原文：The Dutch government is expected to lay out initial plans on Thursday to keep the country's largest company ASML , from moving operations outside the Netherlands over concerns ranging from anti-immigration policies to infrastructure problems.】

item.title: 土耳其硬质小麦流向国外，面食制造商欢呼雀跃
item.description: 土耳其作为硬质小麦出口国所取得的惊人突破，使意大利面爱好者又免受了一年的价格之苦，该国有望继续成为地中海美食中珍贵原料的重要来源。【原文：Turkey's spectacular breakthrough as an exporter of durum wheat has spared pasta fans another year of price pain and the country is poised to remain a crucial source of the ingredient prized in Mediterranean cuisine.】

item.title: 欧洲最高航空安全监管机构对预算紧缩发出警告
item.description: 即将离任的欧洲航空监管机构负责人就资源问题发出警告，并呼吁在应对航空生态系统中的 "系统性风险 "时发挥更大的作用。【原文：The outgoing head of Europe's aviation regulator has issued a warning over resources and called for a bigger role as it grapples with "systemic risks" in the aviation ecosystem.】

item.title: 拜登执政期间，美国石油产量如何不顾气候政策创下纪录
item.description: 创纪录的产量。出口蓬勃发展。就业快速增长。CEO 薪酬和股东回报飙升。【原文：Record production. Booming exports. Rapid jobs growth. Soaring CEO pay and shareholder returns.】

item.title: 美国股市如何在第一季度一路高歌猛进
item.description: 2024 年，美国股市将迎来一个飞速发展的开端，因为对经济和降息的乐观情绪与对人工智能商机的憧憬结合在一起，为股票市场调制出了一杯烈性鸡尾酒。【原文：The U.S. stock market is off to a soaring start in 2024, as optimism over the economy and interest rate cuts has combined with exuberance about the business opportunity in artificial intelligence to stir up a potent cocktail for equities.】

item.title: 比特币价格回升，美国加密货币 ETF 流入量回升
item.description: 在加密货币价格从上周的跌势中反弹之后，本周流入最近推出的九只与比特币挂钩的交易所交易基金（ETF）的资金重拾升势。【原文：Inflows into the nine recently launched exchange-traded funds (ETFs) tied to bitcoin have resumed their upward trajectory this week after the cryptocurrency's price bounced back from its dip last week.】

item.title: 赞比亚债务重组战的伤疤影响了其共同框架的成功
item.description: 赞比亚本周与债券持有人达成的协议表明，该国将最终摆脱长达三年多的违约状态，并成为 20 国集团设计的债务重组架构下首个成功重组的国家。【原文：Zambia's deal with bondholders this week suggests it will finally emerge from more than three years in default -- and become the first successful restructuring under the debt-rework architecture designed by the G20.】

item.title: 瑞安航空公司老板称需要波音公司的波普参与生产，而非首席执行官职位
item.description: 瑞安航空公司首席执行官迈克尔-奥利里（Michael O'Leary）表示，他希望波音公司商用飞机部门新任主管斯蒂芬妮-波普（Stephanie Pope）继续留任，以解决生产问题，而不是被视为该飞机制造商新任主管的竞争者。【原文：Ryanair CEO Michael O'Leary said he wants Boeing's new head of commercial airplanes division Stephanie Pope to stay in the role to fix production problems rather than be considered a contender as the planemaker's new head.】

item.title: 家得宝将以 182.5 亿美元收购 SRS Distribution
item.description: 家得宝（Home Depot）周四表示，它将收购建筑产品分销商 SRS Distribution，包括债务在内的交易价值约为 182.5 亿美元。【原文：Home Depot said on Thursday it would buy building products distributor SRS Distribution in a deal valued at about $18.25 billion including debt.】

item.title: 山姆-班克曼-弗里德哪些事件导致了 FTX 创始人被定罪？
item.description: 山姆-班克曼-弗里德（Sam Bankman-Fried）因其创办的 FTX 加密货币交易所轰然倒塌而被指控犯有欺诈罪，将于本周四被判刑。【原文：Sam Bankman-Fried is set to be sentenced on Thursday over his conviction on fraud charges stemming from the dramatic collapse of the FTX cryptocurrency exchange he founded.】

item.title: 山姆-班克曼-弗里德将因数十亿美元的 FTX 欺诈案被判刑
item.description: 前亿万富翁、加密货币奇才山姆-班克曼-弗里德（Sam Bankman-Fried）因从他创办的现已破产的 FTX 交易所的客户那里窃取 80 亿美元而被定罪，将于本周四被判刑。【原文：Sam Bankman-Fried, the former billionaire cryptocurrency wunderkind, is set to be sentenced on Thursday over his conviction for stealing $8 billion from customers of the now-bankrupt FTX exchange he founded.】

item.title: 律师称巴尔的摩大桥垮塌可能引发诉讼，但数量有限
item.description: 周二撞击巴尔的摩弗朗西斯-斯科特-基大桥的集装箱船的船东、运营商和承租人很可能会因大桥倒塌和人员伤亡而面临诉讼，但法律专家表示，美国海事法可能会限制这些公司的责任。【原文：The owner, operator and charterer of the container ship that struck Baltimore’s Francis Scott Key Bridge on Tuesday are likely to face lawsuits over its collapse and the people killed or injured, but legal experts say U.S. maritime law could limit the companies’ liability.】

item.title: 没有房主保险的高风险经济生活
item.description: 从每月支付按揭贷款，到担心火灾、洪水或龙卷风等灾难，拥有一栋房屋感觉就像在冒险。【原文：Owning a home can feel like risky business, from coming up with the mortgage payment every month to worrying about disasters like fires or floods or tornadoes.】

item.title: 早间竞价：美联储不急于求成，迎来蓬勃发展的第一季度，美元重拾升势
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 山姆-班克曼-弗里德（Sam Bankman-Fried）是何许人也？
item.description: 大学毕业几年后，山姆-班克曼-弗里德开始担心自己承担的风险不够大。【原文：A few years after graduating from college, Sam Bankman-Fried grew worried he was not taking enough risks.】

item.title: 长周末假期前期货价格区间震荡
item.description: 周四，美国股指期货表现低迷，投资者在等待更多数据来判断经济状况和美联储的政策路径，尽管预计进入长周末假期后市场活动将趋于平淡。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were lackluster on Thursday as investors awaited more data to gauge the state of the economy and the Federal Reserve's policy path, though activity is expected to be muted heading into a long weekend break.】

item.title: 中国经济放缓、需求疲软冲击特斯拉交付量
item.description: 随着降价带来的提振作用减弱，以及美国汽车制造商在放缓的电动汽车市场上努力应对争夺买家的激烈竞争，特斯拉预计将于下周公布第一季度低迷的交付量。【原文：Tesla is expected to report sluggish first-quarter deliveries next week as the boost from its price cuts wanes and the U.S. automaker grapples with strong competition for buyers in a slowing electric-vehicle market.】

item.title: 美国要求为政府使用人工智能制定新的保障措施并提高透明度
item.description: 白宫周四表示，随着政府扩大人工智能的广泛应用，要求使用人工智能的联邦机构在12月1日前采取 "具体保障措施"，以保护美国人的权利并确保安全。【原文：The White House said Thursday it is requiring federal agencies using artificial intelligence to adopt "concrete safeguards" by Dec. 1 to protect Americans’ rights and ensure safety as the government expands AI use in a wide range of applications.】

item.title: 泰国为吸引 "世界级赛事 "提供免税优惠
item.description: 泰国周四宣布为大型国际音乐会、体育赛事和节庆活动的组织者减免税收，以吸引大型活动并将自己定位为地区旅游中心。【原文：Thailand on Thursday announced a tax waiver for organisers of large international concerts, sporting events, and festivals to try to attract big events and position itself as a regional tourism hub.】

item.title: 伦敦劳合社发现巴尔的摩大桥垮塌造成数十亿美元的保险损失
item.description: 伦敦劳合社（SOLYD.UL）主席周四表示，巴尔的摩弗朗西斯-斯科特-基大桥的垮塌很可能导致数十亿美元的保险损失。【原文：The collapse of Baltimore's Francis Scott Key Bridge is likely to lead to a multi-billion dollar insurance loss, the chairperson of Lloyd's of London (SOLYD.UL) said on Thursday.】

item.title: 中国取消对澳大利亚葡萄酒的关税，结束长达三年的贸易冻结
item.description: 中国商务部周四表示，中国将从 3 月 29 日起取消对澳大利亚葡萄酒征收的反倾销和反补贴关税，结束长达三年的惩罚性征税，为澳大利亚葡萄酒生产商提供期待已久的救济。【原文：China will lift anti-dumping and anti-subsidy tariffs on Australian wine from March 29, the Chinese commerce ministry said on Thursday, ending three years of punitive levies and offering long-awaited relief to Australian wine producers.】

item.title: 进口关税结束后，库藏葡萄酒将恢复在中国的销售
item.description: 在中国商务部表示将从 3 月 29 日起取消澳大利亚葡萄酒进口关税后，Treasury Wine Estates 公司周四表示，将恢复其部分产品在中国的销售。【原文：Treasury Wine Estates will resume the distribution of some of its products in China, it said on Thursday, after the Chinese Ministry of Commerce said it would remove tariffs on Australian wine imports from March 29.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴回购菜鸟，瞄准竞争对手的海外扩张之路
item.description: 分析人士说，阿里巴巴计划收购其物流子公司的全部控制权，而不是将其分拆上市，这可能预示着这家中国巨头正在海外市场更加认真地对待来自电商竞争对手申银万国和特姆普的竞争。【原文：Alibaba's plan to buy full control of its logistics subsidiary rather than spinning it off could signal the Chinese giant is taking competition from e-commerce rivals Shein and Temu more seriously in overseas markets, analysts said.】

item.title: 在 "充满挑战 "的市场环境下，JD Sports 一月销售额下降
item.description: 英国运动服装零售商 JD Sports 表示，由于 1 月份同类销售额下降，第四季度仅增长了 0.1%，贸易形势依然严峻。【原文：British sportswear retailer JD Sports said trading conditions remained challenging after its like-for-like sales dropped in January, resulting in fourth-quarter growth of just 0.1%.】
